div.p: Click here for a directory of school staff and employees.
A collection of useful links for students can be found by clicking here
We would love to hear from you! Click here to send us a message, and we'll get back to you as soon as possible!
Click here to view LKCISD's State Report Cards for the 2018-2019 School Year.
If you or someone you know has a child with a disability and would be interested in participating in the Lion's Summer Camp, check out the link below!

center.h4: Notice Regarding Student Lunches Being Delivered

div.p: At the board meeting on April 16, the board approved to modify all campus handbooks regarding lunch deliveries to state, "A parent may bring his/her student a lunch and leave it at the front office. We will not accept outside deliveries of food for students during school hours unless approved by an administrator." We have been blessed with being able to offer free breakfast and lunches to all students at LKCISD and would like to continue that program!

"Linden-Kildare CISD is looking forward to another school year. We want your child to have a great experience. We want to remind you that if your child needs immunizations, now is the time to take care of that. He/she will not be able to attend school without the required immunizations. The number for Linden Life Center is 903-756-5581. The health department is 903-756-5208. If you have any questions about your child's immunizations, please call Dawn Hoskins at 903-756-5381. Thank you for your attention to this matter."

hr.p: Linden-Kildare C.I.S.D. offers a free, appropriate, public education with aÂ full continuum of services for children and young adults identified withÂ disabilities from age 36 months through 21 years of age and from birthÂ through 21 years of age for children and young adults with hearing or visionÂ impairments. Â Children from birth to age 3 with other disabilities will beÂ referred to appropriate agencies for services or parents may contactÂ Opportunities, Inc., 6101 N. State Line, Texarkana, TX 75503, or callÂ 903.791.2288.Â Evaluations in the schools are provided for suspected disabilities includingÂ learning disabilities, speech and language development, physicalÂ impairments, vision or hearing impairments, intellectual disabilities,Â emotional disturbance, autism, health impairments, or traumatic brainÂ injuries. Â Services are determined based on each childâ€™s individual needs. Â Once a referral is made the campus will follow its Student Support TeamÂ (SST) process. Â The Student Support Team may refer the student on for aÂ special education evaluation if needed. Â A Full and Individual EvaluationÂ (FIE) is conducted to determine the childâ€™s disability and an educationalÂ need for services. Referrals are confidential and services provided at noÂ cost. Â For more information regarding the referral process and special educationÂ eligibility criteria contact the principal or counselor at each campus: Â
Mae Luster Stephens Jr. HighÂ at 903.756.5381;
Linden-Kildare High School at 903.756.5314; or theÂ
Linden-Kildare C.I.S.D. Special Education Department at 903.756.5314Â x4324, 205 Kildare Road, Linden, TX 75563.

div.class: custom_40953 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomInUp

a.aria-label: Back to top of site

div.p: Linden-Kildare Consolidated Independent School District does not discriminate on the basis of sex, ethnicity, race, color, age, or national origin in its educational programs or employment as required by Title IX, Section 504, and Title VI.
Copyright Â© Linden-Kildare Consolidated Independent School District, 2015. All Rights Reserved
L-K CISD will be the Northeast Texas leader in providing experiences, environment and tools to ensure each child becomes a productive, resilient citizen and leader moving to the next horizon.
